alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 14 at 12:19PM PST until January 15 at 2:15PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, San Luis Obispo. * WHEN...Until 200 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1216 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges continued to indicate moderate to locally heavy rain across the area. Hourly rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.75 inches have been observed. These rain rates will continue to cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Cambria, Cuyama, Grover Beach, Guadalupe, Santa Margarita, Shandon, Templeton and Oceano. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
